conclusion: The image shows four objects casting shadows labeled A, B, C, and D on the ground.
The light source is currently positioned above the objects, causing the shadows to be cast on the ground.
Shadows are formed when an object blocks light from a source, creating a dark area on a surface.
The position and size of a shadow depend on the relative position of the light source to the object.
Moving the light source forward means it will be closer to the objects in the horizontal direction.
As the light source moves forward, the angle at which light hits the objects changes.
